title: Is playing Xayah without Rakan a bannnable offense?
body: Considering we arent allowed to play certain champions in certain roles, how is Riot's stance on this?

replies.body:
> Considering we arent allowed to play certain champions in certain roles

is this a dig at the "unfair" bans of the recent non-meta "supports" (singed/nunu) in which, in reality, they were hardly fulfilling the role they queued up for

just curious :^)

> [{quoted}](name=Slythion,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PQZ4phor,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-04-05T02:55:27.115+0000)
>
> is this a dig at the "unfair" bans of the recent non-meta "supports" (singed/nunu) in which, in reality, they were hardly fulfilling the role they queued up for
> 
> just curious :^)

Its a legit question. Think if someone wants to play them in other roles or lanes. They're literally positioned to the player base as an ADC and her support.
It's hardly legitimate. OP is just trying to be inflammatory.

> [{quoted}](name=Kuronii Lumiira,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PQZ4phor,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2017-04-05T02:59:01.665+0000)
>
> It's hardly legitimate. OP is just trying to be inflammatory.

I disagree. Riot used to have a stance on not enforcing the meta, that has since changed. Both champions have been clearly defined as ADC and support, but we have seen off meta roles with similar champions. These are the first with unique interaction that you will probably never take advantage of if you don't pick them for their specific purpose and role.

only "meta" that riot has truly enforced is a role's purpose

you can be whatever champion you want in whatever role you want (say, support), but if you try to act as a second jungler instead of legitimately supporting (or at least trying to), that's the only time the meta will be enforced.

Role Goal Metas are unchanging
Riot still does not enforce meta in any way. Things only get adjusted if they are out of balance in a different role.
They are made that they can do well without each other. Have each other together just allows them have additional benefits that aren't much.
Don't be obtuse. They work fine in solo roles, of course.

> [{quoted}](name=Kuronii Lumiira,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PQZ4phor,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-04-05T02:51:24.765+0000)
>
> Don't be obtuse. They work fine in solo roles, of course.

If they are to have actual balance they need to be balanced by their solo roles, so the interaction between can't be useful, otherwise your data and balance will be skewed. Imagine trying to balance not only their solo ability, but games where both are in the game, and alternative roles each could play.

Of course they're going to be balanced by their solo performance. What makes you think they're going to do that any differently?

The paired bonuses they get when played together are inconsequential at best. Longer dash range and shared attack speed buff. That's hardly going to make them super-powerful when paired. There's no reason for Riot to predicate changes based on those interactions.

> [{quoted}](name=Kuronii Lumiira,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PQZ4phor,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2017-04-05T02:55:56.268+0000)
>
> Of course they're going to be balanced by their solo performance. What makes you think they're going to do that any differently?
> 
> The paired bonuses they get when played together are inconsequential at best. Longer dash range and shared attack speed buff. That's hardly going to make them super-powerful when paired. There's no reason for Riot to predicate changes based on those interactions.

Its still a point of balancing that needs considered. We have seen this with Rengar/Kha'zix which has since been removed, and was only an enemy vs enemy interaction, not an allied one. 

We can say they'll be insignificant, but what if they build something off meta and take full advantage of the benefits that will end up happening. We of course will see over the course of release, but I'm pointing out that before it will inevitably be changed

So, what? On-hit Rakan whose effectiveness is contingent on Xayah's use of W? I don't think there's going to be much that they can do with those benefits that will pose a significant barrier to balance. 

As for the Rengar + Kha'Zix interaction, that either buffed Rengar's damage significantly or allowed Kha'Zix another evolution - both of which gave two assassins greater kill potential. Even if Rakan built Nashor's tooth and went full AP, I don't think we'd see an explosion of absurd power with the two of them together.

> [{quoted}](name=Kuronii Lumiira,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PQZ4phor,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2017-04-05T03:07:25.698+0000)
>

> 
> As for the Rengar + Kha'Zix interaction, that either buffed Rengar's damage significantly or allowed Kha'Zix another evolution - both of which gave two assassins greater kill potential. Even if Rakan built Nashor's tooth and went full AP, I don't think we'd see an explosion of absurd power with the two of them together.

If your counter argument starts with the words "so what" you probably should just not make said argument and don't try to just get the last word in.

You desperately need to look at their kits separately and then together and see the potential of all.   

Rakan's heal procs if he touches an ally, which his dash distance increases if he dashes to Xayah, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TU9PghCne4w  

Literally not insignificant.

Xayah gives Rakan a 50% AS buff (possibly the steroid and MS too) on her W.

Recall, one can start and the other can hop in right before to both recall at the same time?  I don't think I should have to explain that.

I wasn't saying "so what" dismissively. I was saying "so...what?" I was waiting for a point to be made. 

And don't patronise me. I've seen the videos and understand what they do. Better than you, I think. Rakan's heal procs -when- he touches an ally, not if. An increased dash distance will get him out of trouble, but that'll just make him slippery, not strong. What good will an attack speed buff to do benefit Rakan? Like I said, unless he gets significant AP scaling on his basic attacks, that'll do nothing to make him "unbalanceable". The deferred recall time is nice, I will say that, but it'll only get them out of sticky situations in a different way. 

There's nothing that they can do together that will make them "stronger" than they are solo.

Let's assume their overall winrate would be 50%, i expect them to be at most 52% when paired and 48% when with a different adc/support. Their respective buffs aren't much, just a little boost. It's not different from how certain matchups are better than others.

Some supports synergize better with some adc, in Xayah and Rakan the synergy is forced in a mechanical way.
